title: Reshape operator in ONNX does not take in 2 inputs
body_html: I am converting a pytorch model to ONNX using torch.onnx.export(). My model is using view() to do a reshape. The converted model has a reshape operator that takes in two inputs: a tensor to be reshaped and another tensor specifying the new shape . But ONNX 1.0 only takes in a tensor and drop out the "shape" input and treat it as an attribute. So the converted model cannot be consumed in ONNX 1.0.
body_text: I am converting a pytorch model to ONNX using torch.onnx.export(). My model is using view() to do a reshape. The converted model has a reshape operator that takes in two inputs: a tensor to be reshaped and another tensor specifying the new shape . But ONNX 1.0 only takes in a tensor and drop out the "shape" input and treat it as an attribute. So the converted model cannot be consumed in ONNX 1.0.
